why are we making the pldm to stop till led manager comes up ? 

if led manager comes up early than pldm, then led manager will get an interface added signal from pldm that we had added the lamp test interface - so that it can activate the asserted property.

if led manager comes up late than pldm, then led manager can directly call the asserted property.

So, i believe the code in led manager should be some thing like this:

1. busctl call to check if the lamptest interface is added or  not
2. if lamptest interface is not found - then register an interface added signal(once received it can activate the asserted property).
3. if it is found ,then it can directly set the asserted property.

So, that we can remove this inter service dependency across pldm & led manager.
Agree.. This change should not be in PLDM.. PLDM is hosting a service that the LED manager uses. So ledmanager service file should be having the Wants=pldm ..

we are not setting the Asserted Property if effecter is not found , which should not be the case.

pointer to a design doc or a bit of detail will help
I can add more text here

George, please use this commit message : 

oem-ibm: Implement Host Lamp Tets interface

IBM has a feature called LampTest and what it does is this : 
    - BMC would set the state of LEDs to [ON] on all the BMC accessible LEDs.
    - For LEDs that are not accessible by BMC, a message is sent to the host, so that the host can exercise all the LEDs on the connected drawers and anything else that the BMC does not have access to.

This commit adds support to send message to Host when BMC has to tell the host to exercise LEDs accessible by host.

When host sees the effector is set, it goes ahead and turns [ON] all the LEDs for a specified time and automatically restores the states at timer expiration. BMC does not have to tell the host to stop the test and it is part of host's lamp test requirement.
